DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Thyroid Stimulating Hormone Thyrotropin Measurement Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator that asks whether thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH) was assessed at this timepoint.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Thyroid Stimulating Hormone Thyrotropin Measurement
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH), a hormone produced by the pituitary gland that stimulates the release of thyroid hormone from thyroglobulin.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: A hormone produced by the pituitary gland. TSH stimulates the release of thyroid hormone from thyroglobulin. It also stimulates the growth of thyroid follicular cells. An abnormal TSH level may mean that the thyroid hormonal regulation system is out of control, usually as a result of a benign condition (hyperthyroidism or hypothyroidism).:A measurement of the thyrotropin in a biological specimen.

Concepts.definition: A peptide hormone secreted by the anterior pituitary. It promotes the growth of the thyroid gland and stimulates the synthesis of thyroid hormones and the release of thyroxine by the thyroid gland.
A quantitative measurement of the amount of thyrotropin present in a sample.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have normal baseline thyroid function tests

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Thyroid function TSH within normal limits (pre-existing hypothyroidism is acceptable as long as the patient has been stable on thyroid replacement for four months prior to entering the study)

ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have normal baseline TSH?

ReferenceDocuments.description: Thyroid function TSH within normal limits

ReferenceDocuments.description: Thyroid function TSH within normal limits

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Thyroid function TSH <= 4 x institutional upper limit of normal
